content: #30586 is a slightly odd PR in that it's in a relatively obscure file, but I came across it while working on something tangentially related and I felt pretty sure I could make some solid improvements to it.

Yes, many things can be probably be improved here (I wrote this quite some time ago now!) I can review this at some point, but please bear in mind that this belongs to a not fully merged (the review process was quite long here) ongoing series of PR that proves that SimplexCategoryGenRel and SimplecCategory are equivalent.

I can adapt the already open PRs I the series to these change if they are indeed improvement (from a quick look, it might be!), but it would have been nice to have a heads up that you were working on this beforehand as it is relevant to an ongoing series.
Apologies, I didn't know it was particularly owned by someone - I only did it today.

It's certainly not "owned"! I'll try to review this quick as I still agree that I did things pretty dirtily here (the main goal was the equivalence, this definition of "admissibility" was merely an implementation detail for this!)

Yeah absolutely. Basically my motivation was that I've been improving IsChain recently and I'm also trying to kill Sorted - and I think here basically IsChain is kinda the prototype to use. But then actually the whole thing works nicely as an inductive
Thanks a lot though - it's good to have a subject matter expert here
@Robin Carlier Thank you for the review. I believe I've addressed all of your comments.
Need to run for now but I should have the time for another look this evening.
I am very pleased that we could remove your use of Sorted and in fact I have a suggestion I've made for how to do so entirely.
